title: sea hunter aatrox splash

embed.description: ( With the release of patch 5.12 to live on July 9th, we started the new 5.14 PBE cycle ) Previous PBE Cycles in 2015 Below you will find a comprehensive list of new content, balance changes, and whatever else is included in the current PBE cycle!

body:
i think that its a little off that the splash doesnt really match the in game model. the splash shows him wearing boots while the model is wearing like bandages or something.
idk call it ocd or just being picky but i feel there should be a consistency between the model and splash. kind of like what they did with order of the banana soraka.

replies.body:
Hey Kat Mechanics, 

Thanks for the feedback! 

Both the Sea Hunter Aatrox model and splash are wearing boots - the in-game model's appear to be open toed. While I agree that there should be consistency with the model and the splash, I think this is more of a minor detail, as compared to the color variation when the splash and model was released. Originally, the model was a completely different color from the splash, but, thanks to player feedback, the color was successfully changed to match the splash more. 

Splash art for content is meant to give a general representation of what the content looks like. Of course, we can do a lot more with splash art than we can with in game models, which is why you'll often see some awesome detail in the splash art (take Arclight Vayne's cloth detail in her splash art, for example). 

If you cruise through some splash art, you may notice bits here and there that aren't 100% accurate to in-game; it's usually about 95%. A lot of the time, things appear to be on the incorrect side of the champion, and that's due to the splash being flipped for composition, or so that it fits properly in the Champion Details page (the latter is more for when several champions are sharing the same splash art). 

That said, the point you've brought up is certainly something we can pay more attention to in the future to better represent the in-game content via splash art.

first off thanks for taking the time to comment on my post :3c
and yea i get how splashes arent 100% accurate i just thought that just because it was on the pbe that saying something was slightly more worth saying.

Absolutely! 

I've passed this feedback on to the splash team. ^-^ 

We're always happy to see feedback, whether it's positive or negative, as long as it's constructive (like your post) because it helps us better understand what you're enjoying and what we could improve in the future. 

This feedback came in a bit late, which is why it's a bit harder to change, since as you've seen, it's almost time for the big event (maintenance for the new patch is tomorrow)! 

That said, I don't want to discourage you from leaving feedback! If you have feedback for PBE content and you don't have a PBE account to post on those boards, feel free to leave feedback on these boards. The sooner you can leave feedback the better because that'll give us more time to discuss it and potentially make changes.

Again, thanks for taking the time to leave feedback!
